definition: chip (in gambling)/token (for counting)/ticket/to prepare/to plan/to raise (funds)/resource/means
same as 逶 in 逶迤 winding, curved
to entrust/to cast aside/to shift (blame etc)/to accumulate/roundabout/winding/dejected/listless/committee member/council/end/actually/certainly
can/to be possible/to be able to/will/to be likely to/to be sure to/to assemble/to meet/to gather/to see/union/group/association/CL:個|个[ge4]/a moment (Taiwan pr. for this sense is [hui3])

sentences.english: PC 6 is exactly opposite, on the inner forearm between the two tendons.
sentences.chinese: 籌委會6剛好相反筋，對兩者之間的內在前臂。

sentences.english: He also thanked the exhibition's organising committee headed by Mr John Man and Mrs Irene So.
sentences.chinese: 他並多謝畫展的籌委會共同主席文錫輝及蘇潘慕潔。

sentences.english: Mr. Chan is also an advisor on the HKBU 50th Anniversary Committee.
sentences.chinese: 他亦是浸大五十週年校慶籌委會顧問。

sentences.english: There is the problem of Buggin's turn, an expectation that the award should rotate between regions of the world.
sentences.chinese: 但問題是籌委會的希望和平獎在各大洲之間周旋。

sentences.english: Move the PC into a spot where it is safe from sun rays.
sentences.chinese: 謹籌委會成是安全的地點，從太陽光線。

sentences.english: A fruitful PrepCom meeting is essential to the success of the summit.
sentences.chinese: 開好籌委會，是峯會取得成功的重要保證。

sentences.english: Yang Shengjun, vice-president of CFNA was elected as chairman of the Organizing Committee of IFA.
sentences.chinese: 我會楊勝軍副會長當選爲國際煙花協會籌委會主席。

definition: member of a board of directors
to make a speech/to make some remarks
abbr. for 民主建港協進聯盟|民主建港协进联盟, Democratic alliance for the betterment of Hong Kong (DAB), Hong Kong pro-Beijing party
